page.title: 04Description of ref. 03680070
page.content: This area contains the settlement of Southwell. There has been a lot of residential building in this region since the 1960's and all of the properties are privately owned. The large area of modern properties is often referred to as The Sweethill estate. A modern Infant and Primary school has been built to serve this area. A building of interest is Avalanche church named after a ship wrecked on the rocky coastline of the Island. Relics from the shipwreck are displayed in Portland Museum. Also contained within this area is a large quarry extracting Portland limestone. The quarry employs relatively few people.
